intro: Diplotaxis tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its stems are quadrangular, giving it its common name, and it produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. The leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
